001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.locating;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.shadowroot.ShadowDomUtils;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart.SmartWebDriver;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart.SmartWebElement;
006import java.util.List;
007import java.util.function.Consumer;
008import java.util.function.Function;
009import org.openqa.selenium.By;
010import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
011import org.openqa.selenium.WebElement;
012import org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.ExpectedConditions;
013
014/**
015 * Utility class for finding elements in the DOM, including support for Shadow DOM elements.
016 *
017 * <p>This class provides methods to locate elements normally and within Shadow DOMs,
018 * handling different WebDriver configurations.
019 *
020 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
021 */
022public final class SmartFinder {
023
024   private SmartFinder() {
025   }
026
027   /**
028    * Finds an element without applying any custom logic.
029    *
030    * @param driver The WebDriver instance.
031    * @param by     The locator for the element.
032    * @return The located SmartWebElement.
033    */
034   public static SmartWebElement findElementNoWrap(WebDriver driver, By by) {
035      WebElement element = driver.findElement(by);
036      return new SmartWebElement(element, driver);
037   }
038
039   /**
040    * Finds a single SmartWebElement without additional wrapping or waiting logic.
041    *
042    * @param smartElem The SmartWebElement instance.
043    * @param by        The locator to find the element.
044    * @return A SmartWebElement found using the given locator.
045    */
046   public static SmartWebElement findElementNoWrap(SmartWebElement smartElem, By by) {
047      WebElement element = smartElem.getOriginal().findElement(by);
048      return new SmartWebElement(element, smartElem.getDriver());
049   }
050
051   /**
052    * Finds an element normally with a waiting condition.
053    *
054    * @param driver The WebDriver instance.
055    * @param by     The locator for the element.
056    * @param waitFn The waiting function to apply.
057    * @return The located SmartWebElement.
058    */
059   public static SmartWebElement findElementNormally(
060         WebDriver driver,
061         By by,
062         Consumer<Function<WebDriver, ?>> waitFn
063   ) {
064      waitFn.accept(ExpectedConditions.presenceOfElementLocated(by));
065      return findElementNoWrap(driver, by);
066   }
067
068   /**
069    * Finds a single SmartWebElement using standard WebDriver waiting logic.
070    *
071    * @param smartElem The SmartWebElement instance.
072    * @param by        The locator to find the element.
073    * @param waitFn    A function to apply waiting logic before locating the element.
074    * @return A SmartWebElement found using the given parameters.
075    */
076   public static SmartWebElement findElementNormally(
077         SmartWebElement smartElem,
078         By by,
079         Consumer<Function<WebDriver, ?>> waitFn
080   ) {
081      waitFn.accept(ExpectedConditions.presenceOfElementLocated(by));
082      WebElement element = smartElem.getOriginal().findElement(by);
083      return new SmartWebElement(element, smartElem.getDriver());
084   }
085
086   /**
087    * Finds an element within Shadow DOM, applying wait conditions.
088    *
089    * @param smartDriver  The SmartWebDriver instance.
090    * @param by           The locator for the element.
091    * @param waitFn       The waiting function to apply.
092    * @param waitInMillis Optional wait time in milliseconds.
093    * @return The located SmartWebElement.
094    */
095   public static SmartWebElement findElementWithShadowRootDriver(
096         SmartWebDriver smartDriver,
097         By by,
098         Consumer<Function<WebDriver, ?>> waitFn,
099         Long waitInMillis
100   ) {
101      List<WebElement> elements = smartDriver.getOriginal().findElements(by);
102      if (!elements.isEmpty()) {
103         return new SmartWebElement(elements.get(0), smartDriver.getOriginal());
104      }
105
106      if (ShadowDomUtils.shadowRootElementsPresent(smartDriver)) {
107         return (waitInMillis == null)
108               ? ShadowDomUtils.findElementInShadowRoots(smartDriver, by)
109               : ShadowDomUtils.findElementInShadowRoots(smartDriver, by, waitInMillis);
110      } else {
111         waitFn.accept(ExpectedConditions.presenceOfElementLocated(by));
112         WebElement element = smartDriver.getOriginal().findElement(by);
113         return new SmartWebElement(element, smartDriver.getOriginal());
114      }
115   }
116
117   /**
118    * Finds a single SmartWebElement using a shadow root-aware WebDriver.
119    *
120    * @param smartDriver The SmartWebDriver instance.
121    * @param by          The locator to find the element.
122    * @param waitFn      A function to apply waiting logic before locating the element.
123    * @return A SmartWebElement located using the given parameters.
124    */
125   public static SmartWebElement findElementWithShadowRootDriver(
126         SmartWebDriver smartDriver,
127         By by,
128         Consumer<Function<WebDriver, ?>> waitFn
129   ) {
130      return findElementWithShadowRootDriver(smartDriver, by, waitFn, null);
131   }
132
133   /**
134    * Finds multiple SmartWebElements without wrapping them in additional waiting logic.
135    *
136    * @param driver The WebDriver instance.
137    * @param by     The locator to find the elements.
138    * @return A list of SmartWebElements found using the given locator.
139    */
140   public static List<SmartWebElement> findElementsNoWrap(WebDriver driver, By by) {
141      return driver.findElements(by).stream()
142            .map(elem -> new SmartWebElement(elem, driver))
143            .toList();
144   }
145
146   /**
147    * Finds multiple SmartWebElements without additional waiting logic from a SmartWebElement.
148    *
149    * @param smartElem The SmartWebElement instance.
150    * @param by        The locator to find the elements.
151    * @return A list of SmartWebElements found using the given locator.
152    */
153   public static List<SmartWebElement> findElementsNoWrap(SmartWebElement smartElem, By by) {
154      return smartElem.getOriginal().findElements(by).stream()
155            .map(e -> new SmartWebElement(e, smartElem.getDriver()))
156            .toList();
157   }
158
159   /**
160    * Finds multiple elements normally.
161    *
162    * @param driver The WebDriver instance.
163    * @param by     The locator for the elements.
164    * @param waitFn The waiting function to apply.
165    * @return A list of located SmartWebElements.
166    */
167   public static List<SmartWebElement> findElementsNormally(
168         WebDriver driver,
169         By by,
170         Consumer<Function<WebDriver, ?>> waitFn
171   ) {
172      waitFn.accept(ExpectedConditions.presenceOfElementLocated(by));
173      List<WebElement> elements = driver.findElements(by);
174
175      if (!elements.isEmpty()) {
176         return toSmartWebElements(elements, driver);
177      }
178      WebElement single = driver.findElement(by);
179      return List.of(new SmartWebElement(single, driver));
180   }
181
182   /**
183    * Finds multiple SmartWebElements using standard WebDriver waiting logic.
184    *
185    * @param smartElem The SmartWebElement instance.
186    * @param by        The locator to find the elements.
187    * @param waitFn    A function to apply waiting logic before locating the elements.
188    * @return A list of SmartWebElements found using the given parameters.
189    */
190   public static List<SmartWebElement> findElementsNormally(
191         SmartWebElement smartElem,
192         By by,
193         Consumer<Function<WebDriver, ?>> waitFn
194   ) {
195      waitFn.accept(ExpectedConditions.presenceOfElementLocated(by));
196      List<WebElement> elements = smartElem.getOriginal().findElements(by);
197      if (!elements.isEmpty()) {
198         return toSmartWebElements(elements, smartElem.getDriver());
199      } else {
200         WebElement single = smartElem.getOriginal().findElement(by);
201         return List.of(new SmartWebElement(single, smartElem.getDriver()));
202      }
203   }
204
205   /**
206    * Finds multiple SmartWebElements using shadow root-aware WebDriver logic.
207    *
208    * @param smartDriver The SmartWebDriver instance.
209    * @param by          The locator to find the elements.
210    * @param waitFn      A function to apply waiting logic before locating the elements.
211    * @return A list of SmartWebElements found using shadow root detection.
212    */
213   public static List<SmartWebElement> findElementsWithShadowRootDriver(
214         SmartWebDriver smartDriver,
215         By by,
216         Consumer<Function<WebDriver, ?>> waitFn
217   ) {
218      WebDriver driver = smartDriver.getOriginal();
219      List<WebElement> elements = driver.findElements(by);
220
221      if (!elements.isEmpty()) {
222         return toSmartWebElements(elements, driver);
223      }
224
225      if (ShadowDomUtils.shadowRootElementsPresent(smartDriver)) {
226         return ShadowDomUtils.findElementsInShadowRoots(smartDriver, by);
227      } else {
228         waitFn.accept(ExpectedConditions.presenceOfElementLocated(by));
229         List<WebElement> elementsAfterWait = driver.findElements(by);
230         if (!elementsAfterWait.isEmpty()) {
231            return toSmartWebElements(elementsAfterWait, driver);
232         } else {
233            WebElement single = driver.findElement(by);
234            return List.of(new SmartWebElement(single, driver));
235         }
236      }
237   }
238
239   /**
240    * Finds a single SmartWebElement using shadow root-aware logic.
241    *
242    * @param smartElem The SmartWebElement instance.
243    * @param by        The locator to find the element.
244    * @param waitFn    A function to apply waiting logic before locating the element.
245    * @return A SmartWebElement located using shadow root detection.
246    */
247   public static SmartWebElement findElementWithShadowRootElement(
248         SmartWebElement smartElem,
249         By by,
250         Consumer<Function<WebDriver, ?>> waitFn
251   ) {
252      List<WebElement> elements = smartElem.getOriginal().findElements(by);
253      if (!elements.isEmpty()) {
254         return new SmartWebElement(elements.get(0), smartElem.getDriver());
255      }
256
257      if (ShadowDomUtils.shadowRootElementsPresent(smartElem)) {
258         return ShadowDomUtils.findElementInShadowRoots(smartElem, by);
259      } else {
260         return findElementNormally(smartElem, by, waitFn);
261      }
262   }
263
264   /**
265    * Finds multiple SmartWebElements within shadow DOM-aware WebDriver logic.
266    *
267    * @param smartElem The SmartWebElement instance.
268    * @param by        The locator to find the elements.
269    * @param waitFn    A function to apply waiting logic before locating the elements.
270    * @return A list of SmartWebElements found using shadow root detection.
271    */
272   public static List<SmartWebElement> findElementsWithShadowRootElement(
273         SmartWebElement smartElem,
274         By by,
275         Consumer<Function<WebDriver, ?>> waitFn
276   ) {
277      List<WebElement> elements = smartElem.getOriginal().findElements(by);
278      if (!elements.isEmpty()) {
279         return toSmartWebElements(elements, smartElem.getDriver());
280      }
281
282      if (ShadowDomUtils.shadowRootElementsPresent(smartElem)) {
283         return ShadowDomUtils.findElementsInShadowRoots(smartElem, by);
284      } else {
285         return findElementsNormally(smartElem, by, waitFn);
286      }
287   }
288
289
290   private static List<SmartWebElement> toSmartWebElements(List<WebElement> elements, WebDriver driver) {
291      return elements.stream()
292            .map(e -> new SmartWebElement(e, driver))
293            .toList();
294   }
295
296}
